columns.text: In this problem, we will determine the value of the retirement account after 30 years if we deposit $475 monthly with 10% interest compounded monthly.

To determine the account's value after 30 years, we will calculate the future value.

 As opposed to the present value, the future value is the value of a cash flow at a future date. The future value considers the present value of the cash flow multiplied by the factor of the rate and period.

In calculating the future value, we will use the spreadsheet function FV. 

The FV function determines the future value of an investment founded on constant payments interest rate and period. It is calculated on the spreadsheet using the following formula:

$$\begin{aligned}
FV&=(rate, nper,pmt,[pv],[type]) \\
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

$rate$, which refers to the interest rate\
$nper$, represent the period\
$pmt$, which means the constant payment\
$[pv]$, which refers to the present value\
$[type]$, which indicates the period basis of the computation

We will consider the following details from the problem:

| Particulars                     |       |
|------------------------------------|-------|
| Interest rate (Compounded monhtly) | 10%   |
| Period                             | 30    |
| Constant payment                   | $475  |

First, calculate the rate to be used.

The interest rate of 10% is compounded monthly, so therefore we will divide the interest rate by 12, which represents the 12 months in a year, to determine the rate.

Let's calculate the rate.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Rate} &=\dfrac{0.10}{12}
\\[10pt]
&=0.8333\%
\end{aligned}$$

Hence, the rate we will consider is 0.008333.

Next, calculate the period.

Since the interest is monthly compounded and the given period is in years, we will multiply the years by 12, representing the number of months in a year.

Let's solve the period.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Period} &= 30\times12
\\[5pt]
&= 360
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, the period we will calculate the investment's future value is 360.

We will consider the period and the rate from the previous calculation and the constant payment of $475 from the problem to calculate the future value using the FV spreadsheet function. Please note that the payment value should be negative for the function to work correctly. The PV is zero since there are no present values provided, and the type is also zero since it's on a year-end basis.

Finally, let's determine the future value of the account.

!['slader'](https://slader-solution-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/ba2a7ed9-6f60-4a51-ba33-b3b054e0e448-1641822344710916.png)
 

**Based on our calculation, our retirement account's value after 30 years, if the monthly deposit is $475, with 10% interest monthly compounded, is $1,073,640.**

To conclude, we determined the amount of the retirement account after 30 years by calculating the future value of the constant payments, considering the compounding of interest and the period. The result of our computation is $1,073,640.
